DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the study is to validate the diagnostic performance of the amplified pretracheal stethoscope (APS) to detect sedation-related adverse acute respiratory events in propofol sedated nonintubated children. To determine the sensitivity/specificity and positive/negative predictive value of the APS in detecting sedation-related adverse acute respiratory events in propofol sedated nonintubated children.
DOC.brief_title: The Utility of Pretracheal Stethoscope in Detecting Respiratory Abnormalities in Sedated Children
DOC.criteria: Patients 2 years to 18 years of age undergoing induction and maintenance of propofol sedation at the American Family Children's Hospital (AFCH) Pediatric Sedation Clinic American Society of Anesthesiology score (ASA) of 12 ASA scoring > 3 Oxygen requirement and cardiorespiratory instability Allergy to propofol or its components Patients requiring propofol sedation outside the AFCH Pediatric Sedation Clinic
